comment: If you show up to class and pay attention to the lectures this class will be easy. He provides practice tests and removes a question if the majority of the class misses it. He allows you to drop the lowest test and quiz scores.

Not the best class. I'm pretty sure i slept through almost every class, hard to pay attention. He just reads off a powerpoint. His tests are confusing so take your time and read the chapters beforehand. Does drop lowest test and quiz grade. Do the HW, it bumped my grade up to an A!

I have to say, Econ is not my favorite subject and I have to agree that all the Econ professors here at KSU really suck because all they do is read off ppt slides. The only good thing about this teacher is that he drop one test grade and is willing to curve tests if the majority of the class is doing bad.

Best overall Economics teacher at KSU. He is willing to help, relates real world experience to class topics, and his tests are straight-forward. However, you must go to class and turn-in the homework. I highly recommend his class.

Professor is useless. Can't answer questions in class. Best advice: if you take him plan to spend a lot of time in his office getting help--it's the only way I passed! Get the book and DO THE HOMEWORK!
Extremely confusing tests. I have a 3.5 gpa and I made a 68,68,72, and 59 on all tests...he drops a quiz and test at least. But this class pissed me off. and lowered my gpa

Take him. Might as well. All the ECON 2100 professors are bad, and at least he drops a test and quiz grade. I tutor for this class and SO MANY kids need help because all these teachers do is read off a ppt they didnt make. ADVICE: Read the chapter, take notes, be comfortable with the principles (WHY not HOW), and you'll cruise your way to an EASY A
Unreasonable Tests, Mostly Math Questions, Does not teach, just reads slides from textbook
